title: City and South London Railway
summary: The City and South London Railway (C&SLR) was the first deep-level underground "tube" railway in the world,[1][note 1] and the first major railway to use electric traction. The railway was originally intended for cable-hauled trains, but owing to the bankruptcy of the cable contractor during construction, a system of electric traction using electric locomotives—an experimental technology at the time—was chosen instead.
